title: Microsoft’s Bing Chat is coming to a mobile device near you
description: Microsoft’s Bing Chat is coming to third-party browsers and mobile devices soon, but with limited features.

title: Your Google Search grammar errors are about to get an AI scrub
description: Grammar check is now available in the US, However, it has limits like it's only in English and restricts certain content.

title: Google has a super-secure new way to safeguard your Pixel phone or tablet
description: Binary Transparency lets users see for themselves that their Android software isn't hiding any nasty surprises.

title: How much data are your GPU drivers collecting about you? Quite a lot in Intel's case
description: A new installer for Intel's graphics card driver will introduce an extensive user data gathering program.

title: Honor Magic V2: release date, features, and everything you need to know
description: The Honor Magic V2 is going global soon, and this foldable phone is incredibly thin.

title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 FE: latest news, rumors and everything we know so far
description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 FE and Tab S9 FE Plus could soon land as mid-range tablet options.

title: Notorious spyware app shuts down after attacker breaches and deletes server data
description: A month after suffering a breach, LetMeSpy shuts down, saying it will terminate all operations by the end of August.

title: Threads is coming to your browser and could spell trouble for X
description: Nervous to give the Threads app a go? These two new features might win you over.

title: Iraq shuts down Telegram over privacy concerns
description: A VPN is now needed to keep using the app in Iraq. Here's everything you need to know about the block.

title: Microsoft fixes major security flaw after "irresponsible" jibe
description: A little nudge goes a long way as Microsoft addresses a serious Azure vulnerability.

title: Red Dead Redemption is finally coming to the Nintendo Switch
description: Red Dead Redemption is coming to the Nintendo Switch as well as the PS4 and PS5.

title: The Marvels: release date, trailer, cast, plot, and more
description: The Marvels will fly into theaters in November – here's what you need to know about the Marvel Phase 5 movie.

title: Microsoft Outlook is fixing one of the most annoying parts of sharing large files
description: Microsoft looks to finally solve a major pain point when sending large files in Outlook.

title: Apple is testing a new M3 Mac mini - and I’m hyped
description: Mac mini fans, get ready - we might be getting a new M3 Mac mini very soon

title: Intel to reveal Meteor Lake CPUs in September – and to talk about a ‘bold vision’ for AI
description: New Core Ultra processors will get an airing in just over a month, plus Intel has plenty to share about the future and AI.

title: Photographers should skip the iPhone 15, if these iPhone 16 Pro rumors are true
description: Opinion: The latest iPhone 16 Pro rumors suggest it could get a new sensor and periscope zoom – and that's worth waiting for.

title: You’ll finally be able to watch higher quality YouTube videos and not just on Apple devices
description: YouTube's highest quality tier was previously only available for Apple devices, but now it's rolling out more widely.

title: This AI tool can steal your data just by listening to what keys you press
description: Researchers at Cornell University develop an AI classifier that can work out keystrokes from their sound alone.

title: Leaked iPhone 15 Pro Max case images tease multi-function Action button
description: New leaked iPhone 15 Pro Max case images corroborate existing rumors concerning an Action button.

title: Google wants to lure workers back to the office with...cheap hotel deals?
description: New promotion concerns Google’s on-campus hotel for employees, in case they wanted to pay 2x rent and sleep at work.

title: After Baldur's Gate 3's massive success, Larian wants the next game to be smaller
description: Larian CEO Swen Vincke has stated that the Baldur's Gate 3 studio wants to focus on a smaller game for its next title.

title: Samsung launches new 98-inch 8K Neo QLED and more big-screens could be coming
description: The 8K QN990C is the new top-of-the-range Samsung Neo QLED and it sounds as good as it looks.

title: Even Zoom wants its workers to come back to the office now
description: Zoom is telling workers to return to the office, but it might be a slightly better deal than some other companies.

title: The Steam Deck's popularity has meant Linux is the second biggest OS for Steam
description: A recent Steam hardware survey has revealed that Linux has now overtaken Mac as the second biggest OS for Steam.

title: Secret trick installs Windows 11 without the bloatware – but Microsoft is looking to fix it
description: Windows 11 is getting bloated – but a handy workaround that cuts the junk has been found.

title: Alarm raised over Mozilla VPN security flaw
description: Apparent Mozilla VPN flaw allows threat actors to conduct a myriad of activities, including redirecting traffic to malicious destinations.

title: Even Mario and Twisted Metal can't help Peacock compete with Netflix
description: Despite its increasingly great movie and TV show line-up, Peacock just can't compete with its streaming rivals.

title: Destiny 2 is getting a facelift thanks to "an all-new mechanic"
description: Destiny 2's game director promises to 'expand players' imaginations' with a range of new mechanics on the way.

title: Salesforce wants to help your business its own AI models
description: Bring-your-own-model is coming to Salesforce, as the company looks to help customers create their own applications with Einstein Studio.

title: iPhone 15 release date all but confirmed ahead of Apple’s September event
description: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has corroborated recent iPhone 15 release date rumors.

title: Smartphone sales are plummeting again - even Apple is feeling the squeeze
description: Big players feel the pressure as smartphone sales fall once again.

title: The Samsung Galaxy S23's overclocked chipset is now in a non-Samsung phone
description: The Nubia Red Magic 8S Pro has exactly the same overclocked Snapdragon chipset as the Samsung Galaxy S23.

title: Next Warhammer 40K Darktide patch to bring new high-difficulty missions, quickplay bonuses, and more
description: The next Warhammer 40K Darktide patch will introduce a host of changes including extra-hard levels.

title: Google has some recommendations for keeping your business safe
description: Nation-state attacks have been prevalent in recent months, with mobile devices continuing to be a vulnerabile asset.

title: Killer Instinct to receive surprise tenth anniversary Xbox Series X update soon
description: Iron Galaxy's Killer Instinct is back with a 4K update, improved matchmaking and more later this year.

title: Mortal Kombat 1 welcomes returning Reptile, Ashrah, and Havik to the main roster
description: The latest Mortal Kombat 1 trailer reveals Reptile, Ashrah, and Havik, an original mainstay and reps from the 3D era of the franchise.

title: Diablo 4's newest bug won't be fixed 'for a few days,' leaving some players stuck
description: Diablo 4 players have spotted a new progression bug that won't be fixed for some time as Blizzard is taking its sweet time.
